[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-23 13:36:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': "Do not mark device as processed if it wasn't

Currently treat_devices_added_or_updated in the OVS agent skips
processing devices which disappeared from the integration bridge
during the agent loop.
This is fine, however the agent should not mark these devices as
processed. Otherwise they won't be processed, should they appear
again on the bridge.

This patch ensures these devices are not added to the current
device set.

The patch also changes treat_devices_added_or_updated. The
function now will return the list of skipped devices and not
anymore a flag signalling whether a resync is required.
With the current logic a resync would be required if retrieval
of device details fails. With this change, the function
treat_devices_added_or_updated will raise in this case and the
exception will be handled in process_network_ports.

use the same logic.

Closes-Bug: #1329546

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Required changes:
- fetch all device details first before proceeding with handling ports
  to reflect Juno behaviour.

  get_devices_details_list is not available in Icehouse.
- fixed E128 violation in the backported code.

Change-Id: Icc744f32494c7a76004ff161536316924594fbdb
(cherry picked from commit 90fedbe44ca6bfccce5d71465532fbdc85ee3814)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not mark device as processed if it wasn't

Currently treat_devices_added_or_updated in the OVS agent skips
processing devices which disappeared from the integration bridge
during the agent loop.
This is fine, however the agent should not mark these devices as
processed. Otherwise they won't be processed, should they appear
again on the bridge.

This patch ensures these devices are not added to the current
device set.

The patch also changes treat_devices_added_or_updated. The
function now will return the list of skipped devices and not
anymore a flag signalling whether a resync is required.
With the current logic a resync would be required if retrieval
of device details fails. With this change, the function
treat_devices_added_or_updated will raise in this case and the
exception will be handled in process_network_ports.

For the sake of consistency, this patch also updates the
similar function treat_ancillary_devices_added in order to
use the same logic.

Finally, this patch amends an innaccurate related comment.

Closes-Bug: #1329546

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py

Required changes:
- fetch all device details first before proceeding with handling ports
  to reflect Juno behaviour.
- unit test was modified to run with get_device_details since
  get_devices_details_list is not available in Icehouse.
- fixed E128 violation in the backported code.

Change-Id: Icc744f32494c7a76004ff161536316924594fbdb
(cherry picked from commit 90fedbe44ca6bfccce5d71465532fbdc85ee3814)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-25 21:04:28.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but neutron unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: If151efeb8caae3111515191e238d6e6ae491cd44
"}]
commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but neutron unittests don't currently pass
with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

Change-Id: If151efeb8caae3111515191e238d6e6ae491cd44

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-25 21:31:47.000000000', 'files': ['files/apts/nova', 'files/rpms-suse/nova', 'files/rpms/nova'], 'message': "Add conntrack-tools to nova dependencies

'Error deleting conntrack entries' appears in all
n-net. Adding conntrack-tools/conntrack as nova dependency,

commit_message:
Add conntrack-tools to nova dependencies

'Error deleting conntrack entries' appears in all
n-net. Adding conntrack-tools/conntrack as nova dependency,
in order to eliminate this issue.

This is needed to fix this issue in the grenade case.

Change-Id: Ief9deeb3349a07e22fb365e58f3368c847f845ef
(cherry picked from commit 40f4438f9baa945e451f8a9fc682efe3fdf9b8f7)

commit_message:
devstack exercise for deletion, dns checking

This adds record and domain deletion to the designate.sh devstack
exercise.  This also adds DNS checking for the domain/record operations,
to verify that the changes were made in DNS.  Some functions in
designate.sh were moved to lib/designate and refactored slightly.
This also removes some IPA variables that were refactored into a
backend specific file, and fixes a bug in the ipa backend file.

Closes-Bug: #1326141
Change-Id: Ibb86b0b237b3d73a145733bc88dbc18dddbc20f5
(cherry picked from commit 05291ddbf59f638870a561b1182908b676d92832)

This commit adds the new Keystone TokenModel that will be used to
unify in-memory references for tokens. The initial implementation
of this model works similarly to the AccessInfo model from
keystoneclient, providing a unified set of properties that will
return the data from the token-version specific locations.

Future development will round this model out to be better suited
as an authoratative token data source that can be transformed into
any token format / version.

bp: non-persistent-tokens
'}]
commit_message:
Add the new Keystone TokenModel

This commit adds the new Keystone TokenModel that will be used to
unify in-memory references for tokens. The initial implementation
of this model works similarly to the AccessInfo model from
keystoneclient, providing a unified set of properties that will
return the data from the token-version specific locations.

Future development will round this model out to be better suited
as an authoratative token data source that can be transformed into
any token format / version.

Change-Id: I341e03ac8483f8d6085f4c2c218a28647b9ff2e4
bp: non-persistent-tokens

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-25 22:28:38.000000000', 'files': ['ssl-source.yaml', 'overcloud-source.yaml'], 'message': 'ssl: Add support for multiple CA certificates

In some circumstances, more than one CA certificate may need to be
installed in order to enable proper SSL connections internally
(i.e. OpenStack services communicating with each other) and
externally (i.e. Keystone communicating with LDAPS, or Cinder with
an SSL-enabled Zadara).

This change turns the single SSLCACertificate input into a
CommaDelimitedList value.

Change-Id: I59317629d53f5cfb2ad07cee08015784eafb5a57
'}]
commit_message:
ssl: Add support for multiple CA certificates

In some circumstances, more than one CA certificate may need to be
installed in order to enable proper SSL connections internally
(i.e. OpenStack services communicating with each other) and
externally (i.e. Keystone communicating with LDAPS, or Cinder with
an SSL-enabled Zadara).

This change turns the single SSLCACertificate input into a
CommaDelimitedList value.

Change-Id: I59317629d53f5cfb2ad07cee08015784eafb5a57

subject: Do not allow wheels for stable tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 8736, 'name': 'Terry Howe', 'email': 'terrylhowe@gmail.com', 'username': 'terrylhowe'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-25 15:49:10.000000000', 'files': ['integration-tests/neutronclient-stable.sh', 'integration-tests/openstackclient-stable.sh'], 'message': 'Do not allow wheels for stable tests

The tests against stable versions of consuming projects download the
release packages from the PyPI mirror. Now that there are wheels
available, installing those packages breaks. Rather than completely
rewrite the test scripts, force the sdist to be downloaded.

Change-Id: I574610b934a40aa4e4c017d1f247cc14b81a8160
'}]
commit_message:
Do not allow wheels for stable tests

The tests against stable versions of consuming projects download the
release packages from the PyPI mirror. Now that there are wheels
available, installing those packages breaks. Rather than completely
rewrite the test scripts, force the sdist to be downloaded.

Change-Id: I574610b934a40aa4e4c017d1f247cc14b81a8160

commit_message:
Change V2 image tests to actually run V2 image code

The current tests for image do not run v2 image code, changing
that portion also made it's only test fail.
I opted to change the image delete code and not the test, since
passing the object ID is more in line with the rest of the
project code.

Change-Id: I62e13c063a5d68279dbbf31e59266db6285d73bf

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-03 14:31:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py'], 'message': 'OVS agent: Correct bridge setup ordering

This patch fixes three issues that combined to break tunnel networks.

The first issue was the the failure mode was being set on the
integration bridge after the canary flow was installed. This
immediately wiped out the canary flow.

The second problem was that the main loop would sync tunnel networks
right before resetting the tunnel bridge when the canary flow was
missing. This meant that it would sync all of the tunnels via RPC and
then wipe them out.

The final issue was that after resetting the tunnel bridge in the
main loop, the tunnel_sync variable was not set to True, so the
tunnels would never be resynchronized.

This patch addresses the three issues in the following ways:
1. Set the failure mode on the bridge before the canary flow is
installed.
2. Run the OVS restart logic before the tunnel synchronization.
3. If the restart logic is triggered, set tunnel_sync to True to
trigger synchronization.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py

Closes-Bug: #1292105
Change-Id: I6381e3fee49910127c420dd2e3205c64cdb9e185
(cherry-picked from commit 0e5c50ecb2e2317ca6908a9bcec3bcb8ca6d3af8)
'}]
commit_message:
OVS agent: Correct bridge setup ordering

This patch fixes three issues that combined to break tunnel networks.

The first issue was the the failure mode was being set on the
integration bridge after the canary flow was installed. This
immediately wiped out the canary flow.

The second problem was that the main loop would sync tunnel networks
right before resetting the tunnel bridge when the canary flow was
missing. This meant that it would sync all of the tunnels via RPC and
then wipe them out.

The final issue was that after resetting the tunnel bridge in the
main loop, the tunnel_sync variable was not set to True, so the
tunnels would never be resynchronized.

This patch addresses the three issues in the following ways:
1. Set the failure mode on the bridge before the canary flow is
installed.
2. Run the OVS restart logic before the tunnel synchronization.
3. If the restart logic is triggered, set tunnel_sync to True to
trigger synchronization.

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py

Closes-Bug: #1292105
Change-Id: I6381e3fee49910127c420dd2e3205c64cdb9e185
(cherry-picked from commit 0e5c50ecb2e2317ca6908a9bcec3bcb8ca6d3af8)

commit_message:
Do not query neutron-server for device_id if in cache

If you reboot the dhcp-agent it will query the neturon-server
once per network for device_id though it already knows this
information as it was returned in the initial get_active_networks_info call.
This patch speeds up the sync state performance by an exponential factor.

Change-Id: I8fc92ef1182b8eb71f9454611ec2dff27367cbcb
Closes-bug: #1305265

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-24 19:33:54.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/scheduler/dhcp_agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': "Work around for auto_schedule_networks

Previously, whenever auto_schedule_networks() networks would be called
it would move networks that were mapped to one dhcp-agent to another
dhcp-agent if there status was reporting down. The problem with this
is that it didn't remove the network mapping from the previous dhcp-agent.
Since the status implementation on the agents isn't very robust eventually
all networks will be mapped to every dhcp-agent. This patch avoids
this by not taking the status into account for networks that already
exist. Newly created networks though will be mapped to agents with an
active status.

Change-Id: I7b20f48c30c4cf630f5ff654babb84865ef646ef
"}]
commit_message:
Work around for auto_schedule_networks

Previously, whenever auto_schedule_networks() networks would be called
it would move networks that were mapped to one dhcp-agent to another
dhcp-agent if there status was reporting down. The problem with this
is that it didn't remove the network mapping from the previous dhcp-agent.
Since the status implementation on the agents isn't very robust eventually
all networks will be mapped to every dhcp-agent. This patch avoids
this by not taking the status into account for networks that already
exist. Newly created networks though will be mapped to agents with an
active status.

Change-Id: I7b20f48c30c4cf630f5ff654babb84865ef646ef

commit_message:
Don't expect replies from mute cells

Broadcast messages were failing if a cell stopped responding. We now
only send broadcast messages that need replies to cells that are not
mute.

Closes-bug: #1312468
Change-Id: If242e44535d455894b23af37d6c4aa3d09bb5395

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V agent security groups disabling

Adds a check if the security groups have been disabled and removes
the switch port's ACLs accordingly.

Change-Id: I20d716a3f182b8ea62da6b436b150aa9dafdb1c5
Closes-Bug: #1299156
(cherry picked from commit 6d49834976bc08d2b8f7939bc2a217f5cc81db47)

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V agent security group ICMP rules

Converts ICMP protocol to the equivalent protocol number.
Adds default ICMP reject rules.
Adds default ANY protocol rules if the rule does not
contain any protocol.

Closes-Bug: #1299159
Change-Id: Iff51a58fdb532eda0fe7a63abf96004ee74bb073
(cherry picked from commit f56972193be903c67cd54c57bcc2becf6222aced)

commit_message:
Register LBaaS resources to quotas engine

Adding register_quotas=True argument to
resource_helper.build_resource_info() function
in order to register LBaaS resources to quotas engine

This change is actually a continuation of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/69803
change which was already approved

Closes-Bug: #1305957
(cherry picked from commit f5d33051b6d9b0dd0fe08692758748ed34d50136)

subject: Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8099, 'name': 'Graham Hayes', 'email': 'gr@ham.ie', 'username': 'graham'}, {'_account_id': 8130, 'name': 'Betsy Luzader', 'email': 'betsy.luzader@rackspace.com', 'username': 'bluzader'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-25 21:36:39.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': "Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but designate unittests don't currently
pass with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the

keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

commit_message:
Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but designate unittests don't currently
pass with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

See also Ib54364877a251db48c54dfdc43c503281ea1f04a

Change-Id: I3b3d152148a2055da1e2eaef5f4fbb63ebbde6fa

Set python hash seed to 0 in tox.ini

New tox (>=1.7.0) sets a random python hash seed by default. This is
generally good for testing because it will help keep projects working
regardless of the hash seed, but designate unittests don't currently
pass with a random hash seed so set it to the python default seed.

This change will allow us to use new tox again and remove the
restriction on tox<=1.6.1 to run unittests.

Note this change will need to be backported to the stable branches to
keep unittests there working with new tox as well.

See also Ib54364877a251db48c54dfdc43c503281ea1f04a

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-25 07:49:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/router.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Fix CLI support for DVR"

This reverts commit bfec80a776a53b554a8f2d023d2974539edef3ce.

This patch needs to be reverted until we resolve the issue with
patch 109180.

The previous change introduced a situation where we can only
override the default server side setting from the client side
for "--distributed" when the default is False. But we cannot
override when the default is True.

This is a requirement for DVR and at the same time we don't
want to introduce any new changes that would affect any current
plugins. So we will decide on it later and in the mean while I
will revert it.

Partial-Bug: #1346121
Partial-Bug: #1347960
Change-Id: I261f9e232b1f72ed0cb2f0c1ba218facaba9afcb
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix CLI support for DVR"

This reverts commit bfec80a776a53b554a8f2d023d2974539edef3ce.

This patch needs to be reverted until we resolve the issue with
patch 109180.

The previous change introduced a situation where we can only
override the default server side setting from the client side
for "--distributed" when the default is False. But we cannot
override when the default is True.

This is a requirement for DVR and at the same time we don't
want to introduce any new changes that would affect any current
plugins. So we will decide on it later and in the mean while I
will revert it.

Partial-Bug: #1346121
Partial-Bug: #1347960
Change-Id: I261f9e232b1f72ed0cb2f0c1ba218facaba9afcb

commit_message:
Mistral DSL and Heat template parsers

* Primarily for UI work but may be applicable to the Solum control plane
* Get an ordered task list from a Mistral DSL
* Get a sorted list of Mistral DSL required user input fields
* Get a list of Heat template required user input fields and metadata
* Ability to define the start Mistral Task when parsing
* May generate SVG GUI diagrams of Mistral workflows
* SVG diagrams are resizable now

Change-Id: I71ebbc99568cb347a9d676656765a3654dc7c72b

commit_message:
Fix default_volume_type for Cinder multi backend

The default_volume_type option doesn't support comma separated
arguments. We can only select one default volume type.
We have a variable that contains the default volume type, so we simply use it.

Closes-Bug: 1342569

Change-Id: Ibd080442f00f3d446ec374fc5906f0778d449007
Signed-off-by: Sébastien Han <sebastien.han@enovance.com>

Calculates an exponential backoff delay with jitter for retrying
operations which might fail.

The exponential delay on each attempt gives the service a chance
to process its backlog of retries after it starts responding again.

The jitter adds some randomness to the delay to prevent
multiple synchronised backoff retries from hitting the

'}]
commit_message:
timeutils function retry_backoff_delay

Calculates an exponential backoff delay with jitter for retrying
operations which might fail.

The exponential delay on each attempt gives the service a chance
to process its backlog of retries after it starts responding again.

The jitter adds some randomness to the delay to prevent
multiple synchronised backoff retries from hitting the
service at exactly the same time.

The next change in this series makes use of this function.

Change-Id: Ie209ef62c0da68a5b503354764e5add2b6e5569a

commit_message:
VPNaaS: Separate validation for Cisco impl

Moving validation logic from Cisco service driver, into a
validation subclass, so that it'll be applied during the
persistence phase (so validation failures can block the
persistence, instead of setting to error state).

This is part of the effort to separate out L3 validation
and builds upon the reference implementation changes being
reviewed in 102351.

Note: One unit test is commented out, due to a bug in
oslo.messaging 1.3.0. It will be uncommented later, once
1.4.0.0.a3 or newer is available for use.

Change-Id: I6040e6d8ab32b707bcf67a0882507b7ee2d4bebe
Partial-Implementation: blueprint l3-svcs-vendor-validation

commit_message:
Add support for new fields in network create

Also adds missing network-delete shell command. Additionally changes
the type of vlan and vlan_start to int to match the api samples.

Partially-implements blueprint better-support-for-multiple-networks

Change-Id: I233614431db4737284cceaf8e6b947f50dd84602

commit_message:
changed openvswitch version check command

the result of command "modinfo openvswitch"
contains no version info anymore, so added
the way to get the version info of ovs.
"ovs-vswitchd --version" which is runnable
by anyone on linux (w/o sudo command)

Change-Id: Ia09b7357e25fc172efab088990ce12d1a77af739
Closes-Bug: #1322139

commit_message:
Add X-Auth-Token header in federation examples

cURL examples depicting fetching accessible projects and domains upon
successfull retrieving federated unscoped token should also include
``X-Auth-Token`` header.
This patch adds headers to the examples.

Change-Id: I463e34511b8f9b19012fce955f04a0269d5de9cd
Closes-Bug: #1348680

commit_message:
Enable H233

H233 (and H402) were temporarily disabled as part of the migration to
hacking 0.9. This patch fixes all H233 issues and re-enables
gating on them.

H402 has been removed in hacking
(I9426644fa708e9d5563abe04dc4ad656dbeb3656) so leave this one off as its
going away anyway.

Change-Id: Iae8f132c66c5e345dc2e9c2464f67609887c1475

commit_message:
Initial centos7 support

Initial support for a centos7 image.

This is separate to rhel7 because the major differences are things
like repo and image locations, which are always going to be different.
We should merge any real changes into the redhat-common layers.

Apart from the added support files in centos7/*, the other change is
mostly modifications to redhat-common's extract-image to handle
different partition layouts of the centos7 image.

Change-Id: I943abe5ff0a803f36eda266a79af0d9220edcae7

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-15 00:53:39.000000000', 'files': ['elements/vm/finalise.d/51-bootloader'], 'message': "Handle non-script grub2-install

grub2-install has been re-written [1] so isn't always a shell script,
so just exec it directly.  Also use $() as that follows the rest of

[1] http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/grub.git/commit?id=cd46aa6cefabd7b0fcb15cd614577e1ab8c7a841

"}]
commit_message:
Handle non-script grub2-install

grub2-install has been re-written [1] so isn't always a shell script,
so just exec it directly.  Also use $() as that follows the rest of
the file.

[1] http://git.savannah.gnu.org/cgit/grub.git/commit?id=cd46aa6cefabd7b0fcb15cd614577e1ab8c7a841

Change-Id: Ib4fd7c6854fb485c0da6a79babf4a3d45a8a0f2c

subject: Don't log message for keystone ID query when supressing exceptions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7262, 'name': 'John Vrbanac', 'email': 'john.vrbanac@linux.com', 'username': 'john.vrbanac'}, {'_account_id': 7789, 'name': 'John Wood', 'email': 'john.wood@rackspace.com', 'username': 'woodster'}, {'_account_id': 7973, 'name': 'Douglas Mendizábal', 'email': 'dmendiza@redhat.com', 'username': 'dougmendizabal'}, {'_account_id': 8004, 'name': 'Paul Kehrer', 'email': 'paul.l.kehrer@gmail.com', 'username': 'reaperhulk'}, {'_account_id': 11860, 'name': 'Yang Li', 'email': 'yang.li14@hp.com', 'username': 'yangli'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-23 16:53:44.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/model/repositories.py'], 'message': 'Don't log message for keystone ID query when supressing exceptions

Barbican repo method find_by_keystone_id will check the DB for a
tenant ID.  It also takes a flag, supress_exception, so that a
"tenant not found" type of error won't result in an exception
being percolated to its caller.

When the query is done for a tenant that has never been used
it will raise a NoResultFound which gets caught and only
percolated if the supress_exception flag is false.

Previous to this change, we would log this NoResultFound which
in many cases is expected behaviour (hence the supress_exception
flag).  This could be confusing for someone looking at barbican
logs (or an automated log crawler) since this exception is actually
expected behaviour.

This change moves the logging of the exception so that it only
happens if the supress_exception flag is false.  This keeps these
expected exceptions out of the logs.

Change-Id: I864ab7db19efb2230f43c9287103b97fa7b16beb
Closes-Bug: 1347205
'}]
commit_message:
Don't log message for keystone ID query when supressing exceptions

Barbican repo method find_by_keystone_id will check the DB for a
tenant ID.  It also takes a flag, supress_exception, so that a
"tenant not found" type of error won't result in an exception
being percolated to its caller.

When the query is done for a tenant that has never been used
it will raise a NoResultFound which gets caught and only
percolated if the supress_exception flag is false.

Previous to this change, we would log this NoResultFound which
in many cases is expected behaviour (hence the supress_exception
flag).  This could be confusing for someone looking at barbican
logs (or an automated log crawler) since this exception is actually
expected behaviour.

This change moves the logging of the exception so that it only
happens if the supress_exception flag is false.  This keeps these
expected exceptions out of the logs.

Change-Id: I864ab7db19efb2230f43c9287103b97fa7b16beb
Closes-Bug: 1347205

commit_message:
Set rgw host to short hostname

The radosgw init script on CentOS checks the short hostname
with the one defined in /etc/ceph/ceph.conf. If these don't
match radosgw won't be started.

Change-Id: I215284c0ea24ac4469132c0e34f51bba8357b717
Closes-bug: #1348730

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-24 14:40:52.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/orchestration/json/orchestration_client.py', 'tempest/api/orchestration/base.py'], 'message': "orchestration: tolerate NotFound in wait_for_stack_status

When waiting for a stack to transition to DELETE_COMPLETE status
it's possible to either get that status, or a NotFound exception
so catch the exception and return in that case, to avoid needing
try/except around the wait, or risking races in tests which wait
for DELETE_COMPLETE without a try/except (test_volumes.py)

Change-Id: I4ded172db3c8969075365a0dc6b60d8e3e7db71d
Partial-Bug: #1344989
"}]
commit_message:
orchestration: tolerate NotFound in wait_for_stack_status

When waiting for a stack to transition to DELETE_COMPLETE status
it's possible to either get that status, or a NotFound exception
so catch the exception and return in that case, to avoid needing
try/except around the wait, or risking races in tests which wait
for DELETE_COMPLETE without a try/except (test_volumes.py)

Change-Id: I4ded172db3c8969075365a0dc6b60d8e3e7db71d
Partial-Bug: #1344989

commit_message:
Reserve the keystone high port out of ephemeral

The Keystone high port of 35357 is within the range Linux uses as
the ephemeral port range to reply to connections. Reserve it by
utilising the sysctl element.

Change-Id: I88cef5d95820e1ccf9501ef15ca2ace6efb516c3
Closes-Bug: #1330289

commit_message:
Revamp the symbol lookup mechanism

To complement the adjusted changes in patterns we also want
to allow the execution of patterns to be affected in a similar
manner so that symbol lookup is no longer as restrictive as it
was prior to these changes.

This change adds in the following:

- Symbol lookup by walking through an atoms contained scope/s.
- Better error messaging when symbols are not found.
- Adjusted & new tests (existing ones work).
- Better logging of the symbol lookup mechanism (helpful
  during debugging, although it is very verbose...)

Part of blueprint taskflow-improved-scoping

Change-Id: I146d4d24b7e21b6613ae33541edb5e1434635be9

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-07-19 07:43:13.000000000', 'files': ['ssl-source.yaml', 'overcloud-source.yaml'], 'message': "Fix SSL with HAProxy.

The current configuration of services is that if SSL is in use (signaled by
stunnel.connect_ip) we bind to 127.0.0.1 - which is great, but it breaks
simultaneous non-SSL due to there being no pass-through stunnel equivalent on
all the nodes. As an interim measure, teach stunnel to connect to the ctlplane
address instead. We will need this flexability in future anyway to deal with
mixed-mode configurations, but we don't yet have an SSL only configuration.

The change will permit SSL only by altering the Deployment object only - the
SSL config object should now be flexible enough to run in either mode (but as
yet on an all-one-way-or-the-other basis).

Change-Id: Ibac3dec1fe7b573029482fdd9ad2d2f6223fbce0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix SSL with HAProxy.

The current configuration of services is that if SSL is in use (signaled by
stunnel.connect_ip) we bind to 127.0.0.1 - which is great, but it breaks
simultaneous non-SSL due to there being no pass-through stunnel equivalent on
all the nodes. As an interim measure, teach stunnel to connect to the ctlplane
address instead. We will need this flexability in future anyway to deal with
mixed-mode configurations, but we don't yet have an SSL only configuration.

The change will permit SSL only by altering the Deployment object only - the
SSL config object should now be flexible enough to run in either mode (but as
yet on an all-one-way-or-the-other basis).

Change-Id: Ibac3dec1fe7b573029482fdd9ad2d2f6223fbce0

commit_message:
Permit specification of host in stunnel templates

While we can in principle do this already, there is a bug (1344284)
in heat which breaks our ability to calculate an appropriate unified
line from within heat. Instead, we can pass separate metadata to
os-apply-config and avoid this bug (which has no straight forward
fix).

Change-Id: I820862982afee07d85f1f0ad02b08cd5b0f35e49
Related-Bug: #1344284

commit_message:
Clean up EP-Filter after delete project/endpoint

For endpoint_filter extension we should remove all the endpoint
to project associations when we delete the associated endpoint
or project. Otherwise list_endpoints_for_project and
list_projects_for_endpoint API will return 404 response if the
associated endpoint or project has been deleted. Also, there will
be a lot of dirty data remaining in the database.

Change-Id: I48e9100a8fa92d10b7ffe5f89bfb8ba9cf78a0e7
Closes-Bug: #1305537

commit_message:
Add the 'auth' interface type

There are certain requests that will always want to be sent to the
auth_url.

Add a new interface type to the get_endpoint command of the base
identity plugin such that if you ask for the 'auth' interface it will
give you the auth_url.

Implements: blueprint session-auth-endpoint
Change-Id: If653970354b919fdd6e80c061611c3aad129c574

The warning when TRIPLEO_ROOT was left to default to ~/.cache/tripleo
did not make it clear that other environment variables are also given

commit_message:
Improve warning when TRIPLEO_ROOT is defaulted

The warning when TRIPLEO_ROOT was left to default to ~/.cache/tripleo
did not make it clear that other environment variables are also given
defaults based on that value. So just resetting TRIPLEO_ROOT would
not be enough to give you a working system.

This patch just makes the warning a bit clearer.

Change-Id: Idb1091c252ac83f728cb5734884c5992dd0a1754

commit_message:
Provide openstack-dn2osdbk

This tool converts docutils native XML to docbook. The conversion is
done using XSLT, with some custom XML treatment.

The XSL source is a slightly modified version of Dn2dbk written by Éric
Bellot (http://ebellot.chez.com/dn2dbk/index.htm).

Modify doctest to check and build the HOT guide.

Implements: blueprint heat-templates

Change-Id: If866a5ffe19165c38981493684de550e0df0e36d

commit_message:
Move te-broker default IP address to 1.254

We're moving it to the end of the range to make deploys easier.
At the low end it races with dhcp agents and so forth.

Change-Id: I34600d127ff5b43c775bea07f7217cdc875b8e6a

commit_message:
Calculate expected number of vcpus/mem

Rather than just wait for a single vcpu or a non-zero amount of
memory to be available, we should look at the baremetal flavor and
figure out how many of each we should expect.

Closes-Bug: #1341634

Change-Id: I9d9ce55de3b9ad0f94d087179b9432e9e9e50d74

At present the code waits for `nova hypervisor-stats` to show the
expected number of nodes are registered. However, at this stage the
nodes can be only partially registered. This means that when the
scheduler is asked for a host, it doesn't know EG that there is ram
available and the ram filter fails.

By also waiting for memory to be registered this patch should improve
the timing characteristics and avoid this failure.

Change-Id: I2c08bb3dee44f002442fd5c764d5dffed47ee9ba

commit_message:
Wait longer for BM node registration

At present the code waits for `nova hypervisor-stats` to show the
expected number of nodes are registered. However, at this stage the
nodes can be only partially registered. This means that when the
scheduler is asked for a host, it doesn't know EG that there is ram
available and the ram filter fails.

By also waiting for memory to be registered this patch should improve
the timing characteristics and avoid this failure.

Closes-Bug: 1339532
Change-Id: I2c08bb3dee44f002442fd5c764d5dffed47ee9ba

commit_message:
Maybe install os-cloud-config from $TRIPLEO_ROOT

When running under CI we still only check the latest release of
os-cloud-config. If $ZUUL_PROJECT matches os-cloud-config, then
install it from $TRIPLEO_ROOT.

Change-Id: Ic7e86e5454d3da1b7c8de1934abce2a4bd293450

commit_message:
Update RHEL7 element since release

This patch updates the RHEL7 element to work
properly now that it has changed from beta to
release status.  It includes a repo update to
locate os-config rpms not in epel yet and an
update to the latest cloud image name.

Change-Id: I05607d62193c8f8fb1c1bece9872d456b19c5a08

commit_message:
Adding more descriptive error message

Keystone Trusts API sends non descriptive error message for requests with
invalid trust id.
The error message only contains invalid_trust_id  instead of printing:
"Could not find trust: invalid_trust_id"
Setting kwarg "trust_id" in the exception.

Closes-Bug: #1305272
Change-Id: I35cab35ab90cf66ce7124dea142013bec9eefda9

This review extends Keystone/LDAP integration delivered with
https://review.openstack.org/106175 with a new option: instead of
reconfiguring the main identity backend, LDAP identity backend is
created as additional domain specific configuration. Main identity
backend remains SQL-based for legacy v2 support.

commit_message:
Keystone LDAP domain configuration

This review extends Keystone/LDAP integration delivered with
https://review.openstack.org/106175 with a new option: instead of
reconfiguring the main identity backend, LDAP identity backend is
created as additional domain specific configuration. Main identity
backend remains SQL-based for legacy v2 support.

The keystone-ldap-domain element is delivered with
https://review.openstack.org/108117

Change-Id: Ie3ca0e81e734d256280626df76cf7699fc891688

subject: Idempotency for keystone initialization
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-24 18:41:01.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/register-endpoint', 'scripts/os-adduser'], 'message': 'Idempotency for keystone initialization

This review applies some fixes needed for Keystone/LDAP integration.
Generally, when Keystone uses LDAP as backend, users are expected to be
pre-configured in LDAP. Calling user-create when keystone is connected
to LDAP will cause error, so all user-create operations must be called
only if user does not exist yet. Other initialization steps like
user/role mappings still should be called in this case, so user
existence check should not be used to determine if operation is needed.

Idempotency was already added for admin user in os-cloud-config wth
with https://review.openstack.org/100719.

Change-Id: Ifddb9f2d98307324efb7795c025cb1b0a41d7dde
'}]
commit_message:
Idempotency for keystone initialization

This review applies some fixes needed for Keystone/LDAP integration.
Generally, when Keystone uses LDAP as backend, users are expected to be
pre-configured in LDAP. Calling user-create when keystone is connected
to LDAP will cause error, so all user-create operations must be called
only if user does not exist yet. Other initialization steps like
user/role mappings still should be called in this case, so user
existence check should not be used to determine if operation is needed.

Idempotency was already added for admin user in os-cloud-config wth
with https://review.openstack.org/100719.

Change-Id: Ifddb9f2d98307324efb7795c025cb1b0a41d7dde

when instance resize, it will call finish_migration at last to create
new instance and destroy old instance. If driver layer has problem in
create new instance, the instance will be set to 'ERROR' state.

we are able to use reset-state --active to reset the instance and use it
but the instance information is set to new flavor

Closes-Bug: #1296519
"}]
commit_message:
Restore instance flavor info when driver finish_migration fails

when instance resize, it will call finish_migration at last to create
new instance and destroy old instance. If driver layer has problem in
create new instance, the instance will be set to 'ERROR' state.

we are able to use reset-state --active to reset the instance and use it
but the instance information is set to new flavor
and not reverted to old one

Change-Id: I5961260f50e7893c7bf03e329e06edfd4f295640
Closes-Bug: #1296519

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-25 04:28:12.000000000', 'files': ['elements/keystone/install.d/keystone-package-install/05-keystone', 'elements/keystone/install.d/keystone-source-install/70-keystone'], 'message': 'Keystone/LDAP integration

Installs python-ldap and ldappool modules into Keystone virtual environment.

Configuration settings related to LDAP are supposed to be set via
passthrough feature (i.e. injected into /etc/keystone/keystone.conf file
by setting "keystone" field of $OVERCLOUD_EXTRA_CONFIG env variable).

Change-Id: I6a28e3623819b60dc411f54660c2ad714d9afb9b
'}]
commit_message:
Keystone/LDAP integration

Installs python-ldap and ldappool modules into Keystone virtual environment.

Configuration settings related to LDAP are supposed to be set via
passthrough feature (i.e. injected into /etc/keystone/keystone.conf file
by setting "keystone" field of $OVERCLOUD_EXTRA_CONFIG env variable).

Change-Id: I6a28e3623819b60dc411f54660c2ad714d9afb9b

commit_message:
Revert "Cleanup apt cache after grub install"

This calls chroot as a non-root user, which will always fail with
EPERM.

This reverts commit ab2d1a31f2177b26aada075201712b0061a1b771.

Change-Id: Ie674fef694ad66e1ebc22083dec2a0bc34371e7b

commit_message:
Handy utility to deep merge JSON strings

Deep-merge JSON strings provided via a command line. This can be
used to compose a JSON string for $OVERCLOUD_EXTRA_CONFIG
environment variable used for "passthrough" feature.

Change-Id: If292e490d7446f4f9ab5744526beaebfe91e20d5

commit_message:
api: allow to retrieve resources details when listing

This allow to list resources via the generic type endpoint with adding
either ?details=true in the query or Accept: details=true in the headers.

commit_message:
mysql: call os-svc-enable

When configuring MySQL we should always auto-start the MySQL
daemon on startup. This prevents breaking simple use cases
like rebooting nodes, etc.

Change-Id: I15e54f54cbda2f030215f18da12f8a07ada4ca4d
Closes-bug: #1343329

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-07-15 17:50:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/cisco/test_network_db.py', 'neutron/plugins/cisco/db/network_db_v2.py', 'neutron/plugins/cisco/n1kv/n1kv_neutron_plugin.py'], 'message': 'update vsm credential correctly

Today if we modify the n1kv VSM credential in the cisco_plugins.ini, the
older VSM ip address remains in the db, and all requests are sent to
the older VSM. This patch deletes all n1kv VSM credentials on neutron
start up before adding the newer VSM credentials. Hence making sure
that there is only one n1kv VSM IP address and credential in the db.

Change-Id: I772a86bf896a1d3d9c69c545ce6918b0fe3a2e48
Closes-Bug: #1341014
'}]
commit_message:
update vsm credential correctly

Today if we modify the n1kv VSM credential in the cisco_plugins.ini, the
older VSM ip address remains in the db, and all requests are sent to
the older VSM. This patch deletes all n1kv VSM credentials on neutron
start up before adding the newer VSM credentials. Hence making sure
that there is only one n1kv VSM IP address and credential in the db.

Change-Id: I772a86bf896a1d3d9c69c545ce6918b0fe3a2e48
Closes-Bug: #1341014

subject: Add db::mysql and db::mysql::host_access to openstacklib
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7155, 'name': 'Sebastien Badia', 'email': 'seb@sebian.fr', 'username': 'sbadia'}, {'_account_id': 7156, 'name': 'Mathieu Gagné', 'email': 'mgagne@calavera.ca', 'username': 'mgagne'}, {'_account_id': 7822, 'name': 'Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)', 'email': 'chris@hogepodge.com', 'username': 'hogepodge'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2014-07-15 17:28:06.000000000', 'files': ['Modulefile', 'spec/defines/openstacklib_db_mysql_spec.rb', '.fixtures.yml', 'manifests/db/mysql/host_access.pp', 'manifests/db/mysql.pp', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Add db::mysql and db::mysql::host_access to openstacklib

The openstacklib::db::mysql resource is a library resource that can be used by
nova, cinder, ceilometer, etc., rather than replicating equivalent
functionality across all of these modules.

This resource reimplements most of the functionality of the puppetlabs
mysql::db resource. The primary purpose of writing this code from scratch
rather than using the mysql::db resource is to allow the use of a password
hash rather than a plaintext password as a parameter. Other differences from
the mysql::db implementation are:

* It does not have an ensure parameter, we will assume the db should be present
* It does not accept and execute arbitrary SQL because the db sync exec manages
  the state of the db
* It does not use ensure_resource because the database and user should only be
  created from within this resource and creating them elsewhere should be an
  error

Implements: blueprint commmon-openstack-database-resource

Change-Id: I76bd93d1579179932d1f48cea4bb80a2576a7fba
'}]
commit_message:
Add db::mysql and db::mysql::host_access to openstacklib

The openstacklib::db::mysql resource is a library resource that can be used by
nova, cinder, ceilometer, etc., rather than replicating equivalent
functionality across all of these modules.

This resource reimplements most of the functionality of the puppetlabs
mysql::db resource. The primary purpose of writing this code from scratch
rather than using the mysql::db resource is to allow the use of a password
hash rather than a plaintext password as a parameter. Other differences from
the mysql::db implementation are:

* It does not have an ensure parameter, we will assume the db should be present
* It does not accept and execute arbitrary SQL because the db sync exec manages
  the state of the db
* It does not use ensure_resource because the database and user should only be
  created from within this resource and creating them elsewhere should be an
  error

Implements: blueprint commmon-openstack-database-resource

Change-Id: I76bd93d1579179932d1f48cea4bb80a2576a7fba

commit_message:
VMWare: don't notify on disassociate_floatingips()

L3 agent notifications don't make sense for NSX VMWare plugin since
there is no L3 agent in such setup, so disabling them here.

Updated a unit test to check that notification is indeed not requested.

Change-Id: I9c7c32d02d466098d22df8f10448361c3d99174c
Related-Bug: 1330955

commit_message:
Tries to get NIC by name if mac was changed

Fuel loses nodes when some node was added to cluster and then mac-addresses
of NICs have been changed. Since now the issue is fixed.

The fix is based on the assumption that a NIC name is unique within a
node, and if we can't get an interface by MAC, we can try to get it by
name.

Closes-Bug: #1282568
Change-Id: I612a183d51ebb00afbf753ae3ee8dbccac54a4c4

commit_message:
Raise DBReferenceError on foreign key violation

SQLAlchemy session code now parses foreign key violations and returns a
new custom exception so we can track them.

Change-Id: If5610b5743203a5c34ac7df240e5332c39911c4a

subject: Sync RPC module from oslo, fixing reconnect failures
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-25 10:39:18.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/openstack/common/rpc/impl_kombu.py', 'ceilometer/openstack/common/rpc/impl_qpid.py'], 'message': "Sync RPC module from oslo, fixing reconnect failures

This change syncs the following patches from oslo-incubator RPC:
- I67923cb024bbd143edc8edccf35b9b400df31eb3
- Ia148baa6e1ec632789ac3621c85173c2c16f3918

RabbitMQ: advance thru the list of brokers on reconnect

In RabbitMQ implementation, when using multiple rabbit_hosts, we don't want to
immediately retry failed connection for the same failed broker. This was not
the case in existing implementation though, where we've always attempted to
reconnect starting from the first broker in the list of candidates. So if the
first broker failed, we initiated reconnect to the same failed broker.

This change makes reconnect() implementation to select the next broker in the
list. This also means that non-failure reconnect attempts will also switch the
current broker. All in all, users should not rely on any particular order to
use brokers from the list, so this should not constitute an issue.

Qpid: advance thru the list of brokers on reconnect

In Qpid implementation, when using multiple qpid_hosts, we don't want to
immediately retry failed connection for the same failed broker. This was not
the case in existing implementation though, where we've always attempted to
reconnect starting from the first broker in the list of candidates. So if the
first broker failed, we initiated reconnect to the same failed broker.

This change makes reconnect() implementation to select the next broker in the
list. This also means that non-failure reconnect attempts will also switch the
current broker. All in all, users should not rely on any particular order to
use brokers from the list, so this should not constitute an issue.

Partial-Bug: #1261631
Change-Id: Ie9c4de2c094a5d420acca5e4a49ee6a36279ed87
"}]
commit_message:
Sync RPC module from oslo, fixing reconnect failures

This change syncs the following patches from oslo-incubator RPC:
- I67923cb024bbd143edc8edccf35b9b400df31eb3
- Ia148baa6e1ec632789ac3621c85173c2c16f3918

RabbitMQ: advance thru the list of brokers on reconnect

In RabbitMQ implementation, when using multiple rabbit_hosts, we don't want to
immediately retry failed connection for the same failed broker. This was not
the case in existing implementation though, where we've always attempted to
reconnect starting from the first broker in the list of candidates. So if the
first broker failed, we initiated reconnect to the same failed broker.

This change makes reconnect() implementation to select the next broker in the
list. This also means that non-failure reconnect attempts will also switch the
current broker. All in all, users should not rely on any particular order to
use brokers from the list, so this should not constitute an issue.

Qpid: advance thru the list of brokers on reconnect

In Qpid implementation, when using multiple qpid_hosts, we don't want to
immediately retry failed connection for the same failed broker. This was not
the case in existing implementation though, where we've always attempted to
reconnect starting from the first broker in the list of candidates. So if the
first broker failed, we initiated reconnect to the same failed broker.

This change makes reconnect() implementation to select the next broker in the
list. This also means that non-failure reconnect attempts will also switch the
current broker. All in all, users should not rely on any particular order to
use brokers from the list, so this should not constitute an issue.

Partial-Bug: #1261631
Change-Id: Ie9c4de2c094a5d420acca5e4a49ee6a36279ed87

commit_message:
Calculate a suitable column width for positional arguments

Overwrite the method add_arguments in the class
OpenStackHelpFormatter to calculate a suitable columnt width
(max_help_position) for the positional arguments.

example output before this patch:

    ec2-credentials-create
                        Create EC2-compatible credentials for user per tenant.
    ec2-credentials-delete
                        Delete EC2-compatible credentials.
    ec2-credentials-get
                        Display EC2-compatible credentials.
    ec2-credentials-list
                        List EC2-compatible credentials for a user.

example output after this patch:

    ec2-credentials-create  Create EC2-compatible credentials for user per
                            tenant.
    ec2-credentials-delete  Delete EC2-compatible credentials.
    ec2-credentials-get     Display EC2-compatible credentials.
    ec2-credentials-list    List EC2-compatible credentials for a user.

Change-Id: Ibd5d3502022d2afcfd4f57fef9a0bbf23d34b767
Closes-Bug: #1326471

commit_message:
Prevent error message when creating a user

keystone changed behaviour and didn't add the user
to the specified role. Now it does; this patch
prevents an exception popping up without breaking
with previous versions.

Change-Id: I115a5126b70ae3c7733aa065bf55104f88cc42e5
Closes-Bug: #1260439
(cherry picked from commit f5ded29d9a73db4c225cbfb664e7d85e5aa0996b)

fix pexpect.spawn.closed typo - no such method

the pexpect.spawn.closed method does not exist, but pexpect.spawn.close
does. The test code used the former which caused unpredictable method
missing errors.

commit_message:
Fixed bug with empty "volumes" when heat engine is used

commit_message:
Add template version for the provider template

The unittest "test_properties_type_mismatch" in
test_provider_template.py, the provider template misses the template
version, so there will be a "missing template version" exception, not
the expected "type mismatch" exception.

Closes-Bug: #1325146
Change-Id: Id836a7bd31dcbb4072743560cc1b314fc3073852

Code partially refactored to proper use of DB transactions:

Change-Id: I520efc9a4b0b52feae4b86309da653ade50c7c9c
'}]
commit_message:
Deadlocks and random CI tests failures are fixed

Code partially refactored to proper use of DB transactions:
 - receiver partially refactored from DB models to Nailgun objects
 - locking of objects added into reveiver
 - task manager partially refactored
 - DB commits removed from receiver
 - weird DB commit removed from Nailgun task object
 - weird logic for repeating tests on deadlocks removed
 - in fake tasks reveiver methods calling wrapped by try/except
 - filtering of empty collection in NailgunCollection fixed
 - ordering by id added into getting Task object by uuid in case of locking
 - values from consts module used instead hardcoded values in many places

Implements blueprint nailgun-db-transactions
Closes-Bug: #1340703

Change-Id: I520efc9a4b0b52feae4b86309da653ade50c7c9c

commit_message:
Upgrades, fix rollback for bootstrap engine

* changed rollback strategy for bootstrap
  upgrade engine, in previous strategy we
  made symlink from previous version of
  bootstrap to /var/www/nailgun/bootstrap
  it doesn't work because in 5.0 version
  cobbler container mounts /var/www/nailgun
  directory as /repo, as result symlinks
  which we make on the host system are
  broken inside of container.

  Instead of symlink command we rename
  previous version to /var/www/nailgun/bootstrap

* use lexists instead of exists because
  exists returns False on broken symlinks

* fixed docker engine rollback, there
  was wrong definition of previous version
  of fuel

Change-Id: Id0b50835410e005fde76f421981b4616211ddcbf
Closes-bug: #1348166

commit_message:
Upgrades, fix rollback for bootstrap engine

* changed rollback strategy for bootstrap
  upgrade engine, in previous strategy we
  made symlink from previous version of
  bootstrap to /var/www/nailgun/bootstrap
  it doesn't work because in 5.0 version
  cobbler container mounts /var/www/nailgun
  directory as /repo, as result symlinks
  which we make on the host system are
  broken inside of container.

  Instead of symlink command we rename
  previous version to /var/www/nailgun/bootstrap

* use lexists instead of exists because
  exists returns False on broken symlinks

* fixed docker engine rollback, there
  was wrong definition of previous version
  of fuel.

Change-Id: Id0b50835410e005fde76f421981b4616211ddcbf
Closes-bug: #1348166

commit_message:
Additional SELinux scripts

Created wrapper scripts around semanage fcontext and
restorecon commands.

For a lay person, these scripts are easier to understand. We also
check if SELinux is available within the script, so it will reduce
the amount of code currently in the SELinux orc scripts when they
are refactored.

Change-Id: I7fdd7d52e255a50d4900f35aba4b3390c68e6651

node_locked_retry_attempts config options for tests. The commit
428c24767575419d5b472b52f2b622588a3a7253 introduced a new retry mechanism
for the NodeLocked exception but the config options weren't resetted for

Change-Id: Ia516ede357b00ebb19d10f2f603a3e766478c1b3
"}]
commit_message:
Tune down node_locked_retry_{attempts,interval} config for tests

Tune down the node_locked_retry_interval and
node_locked_retry_attempts config options for tests. The commit
428c24767575419d5b472b52f2b622588a3a7253 introduced a new retry mechanism
for the NodeLocked exception but the config options weren't resetted for
the tests so the tests verifying that exception were wasting time sleeping.

Closes-Bug: #1348586
Change-Id: Ia516ede357b00ebb19d10f2f603a3e766478c1b3

subject: Add RPC version to test_get_driver_properties
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3099, 'name': 'David Shrewsbury', 'email': 'dshrewsb@redhat.com', 'username': 'dshrews'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-25 09:33:22.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'Add RPC version to test_get_driver_properties

We should be explicit about which version is required by that RPC
call. The test works now because it needs the current last RPC version
(1.16), but any subsequent update on the RPC layer will cause that test
to fail.

Change-Id: I77d8ad8486a1ae58ed150bb08acc99b0f55792c3
'}]
commit_message:
Add RPC version to test_get_driver_properties

We should be explicit about which version is required by that RPC
call. The test works now because it needs the current last RPC version
(1.16), but any subsequent update on the RPC layer will cause that test
to fail.

Change-Id: I77d8ad8486a1ae58ed150bb08acc99b0f55792c3

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-07-08 20:28:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', 'neutron/db/api.py'], 'message': 'Add retry_on_deadlock decorator to retry DB operations

Port retry_on_deadlock decorator from nova
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22276 . Add this decorator to some
methods in db_base_plugin and ml2 plugin, to retry a transaction if it
gets rolled back because of a deadlock. Deadlocks are a classis problem
in relational DB and they are due to the fact that no operation is really
atomic.

Fixes-bug: 1338606
Change-Id: Ie155cb2efa67b34f7c1435c243d3f3658bfcd7e3
'}]
commit_message:
Add retry_on_deadlock decorator to retry DB operations

Port retry_on_deadlock decorator from nova
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22276 . Add this decorator to some
methods in db_base_plugin and ml2 plugin, to retry a transaction if it
gets rolled back because of a deadlock. Deadlocks are a classis problem
in relational DB and they are due to the fact that no operation is really
atomic.

Fixes-bug: 1338606
Change-Id: Ie155cb2efa67b34f7c1435c243d3f3658bfcd7e3

commit_message:
Sync apiclient from oslo-incubator

Need to sync the latest apiclient from oslo-incubator to make nova
cli cache work. Command used:
python update.py --base novaclient --dest-dir ../python-novaclient/ \
--modules apiclient

syncd patches:

apiclient:
  * 12341ef504 Merge "Restore UUID and human-ID bash completion"
  * 468afcb335 Merge "Don't slugify names that don't exist"

Change-Id: Iec2ad851b47628c5dde4272f438cce4150e11912
Close-bug: 1337033

commit_message:
Fix booting from volume when using api v3

The current code in novaclient/base.py, class BootingManagerWithFind
do not take in account the differences required to boot an instance from
a volume in API v3. V3 expects UUID as volume id and also the source type
to be set.

Change-Id: Id8cfb2d7811aead27cb26cf7ff615c7a9ed05d54
Close-bug: 1325303

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-07-15 04:28:53.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/v1_1/test_shell.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Description is mandatory parameter when creating Security Group

As per the bug, description should not be a mandatory parameter
as it creates inconsistency with other opestack items which has
description as an optional parameter.

So in the fix, the description argument has been made optional.
The old command was:
nova secgroup-create <name> <description>
Now new command will be:
nova secgroup-create <name> [<description>]

Patch updated based on the comments received

Updated commit message for gerrit autolink

Closes-Bug: #1332133
Change-Id: I2ded915be4a57f3c46e6cf5d1bf00e8c917cd0b9
'}]
commit_message:
Description is mandatory parameter when creating Security Group

As per the bug, description should not be a mandatory parameter
as it creates inconsistency with other opestack items which has
description as an optional parameter.

So in the fix, the description argument has been made optional.
The old command was:
nova secgroup-create <name> <description>
Now new command will be:
nova secgroup-create <name> [<description>]

Patch updated based on the comments received

Updated commit message for gerrit autolink

Closes-Bug: #1332133
Change-Id: I2ded915be4a57f3c46e6cf5d1bf00e8c917cd0b9

commit_message:
Replace UserManager with None in tests

Don't access keystoneclient's UserManager in tests. This should be
considered private data of keystoneclient and is not actually used by
horizon tests.

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/keystone_data.py

commit_message:
sync periodic_task fix from incubator

Set the value of time the periodic task was last run to a multiple of the
spacing value rather than the actual last time run. This ensures tasks runs
regularly but avoids synchronizing that interval with other nodes.

This patch also removes the coalescing of tasks which are _nearby_ (0.2
seconds away).

4dbd3aa Make periodic tasks run on regular spacing interval
21249f1 Fix parenthesis typo misunderstanding in periodic_task

Change-Id: I8873545578f104fd204fbc25493350128b2bc8d4

commit_message:
Fix exception names and CLI args

Fixes two bugs:
* Renames HTTPNotFound -> NotFound to match openstack.common.exceptions
* Fixes positional argument names (package-id -> id with metavar) and
  adds shell tests to check parsing
* Uses temporary files in unit tests to correct intermittent test failure

Change-Id: I273e9af6e55f20965b143290c207e88ee062b0c0
Closes-Bug: #1339208

commit_message:
cinder-volume: install qemu-img for conversions

Updates the cinder-volume element so that it installs the
qemu-img package. This is required in order to support
boot from volume conversions from Glance images (qcow2).

Change-Id: I1c6fb4692166b173092395967ffe9fe88ffdb602
Partial-bug: #1340479

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-07-16 16:17:57.000000000', 'files': ['elements/cinder/os-apply-config/etc/cinder/cinder.conf', 'elements/cinder-volume/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/70-cinder-conversion-dir'], 'message': "Create/configure cinder's image_conversion_dir

Updates the cinder element to provide a new top level configuration
for cinder.image_conversion_dir. We are doing this as a top level
config because we also want to create this directory on disk as
well... and using os-apply-config to supply that default makes
sense. (using the pass-thru config would seem to be a bad choice
for this given we need to create a directory if it is set).

The cinder-volume element has been updated to create the
configured image_conversion_dir. If no image_conversion_dir
the default value is created at /mnt/state/var/lib/cinder/conversion.

Change-Id: Ibe8c20b7c815bb84d40a8593e51e82be95e01ec0
Closes-bug: #1340479
"}]
commit_message:
Create/configure cinder's image_conversion_dir

Updates the cinder element to provide a new top level configuration
for cinder.image_conversion_dir. We are doing this as a top level
config because we also want to create this directory on disk as
well... and using os-apply-config to supply that default makes
sense. (using the pass-thru config would seem to be a bad choice
for this given we need to create a directory if it is set).

The cinder-volume element has been updated to create the
configured image_conversion_dir. If no image_conversion_dir
the default value is created at /mnt/state/var/lib/cinder/conversion.

Change-Id: Ibe8c20b7c815bb84d40a8593e51e82be95e01ec0
Closes-bug: #1340479

commit_message:
Adding start/end time to data processing-job execution details

For the data processing -> job execution -> details page, we
are adding start/end time for the job execution as details
for the job execution being viewed.

commit_message:
Add a local datasource collector to occ

This spec details adding a local datasource collector to
os-collect-config. The collector will collect configuration data from
well known directories, allowing multiple elements to install and apply
configuration data to an instance in the same image build. This will allow
elements to supply configuration data for runtime consumption.

Change-Id: I221a38dff2064ff0df0628140d80498949c6d16d

commit_message:
Use /usr/bin/env python instead of /usr/bin/python

The usage of /usr/bin/env ensures that the first interpreter
found in the environment's $PATH variable is used. This should
be preferred.

Change-Id: Icb9be2b208ae95f30d25f5645f9ba864efabcdd7

commit_message:
Adding sanitization for trusts in JobExecution model

Although there is no data model update to JobExecution there are some
minor changes to ensure that trust ids don't leak from the JobExecution
representations.

Changes
* adding sanitizing for trusts to the JobExecution Resource
* adding testing for trusts filter from JobExecution

Partially implement: blueprint edp-swift-trust-authentication
Change-Id: If88bba39efdab01195878a5b1d43bb6c975531b9

Since 1fde418207c004744dcc0d510bd88973ec05721a, os-config-applier is
deprecated. os-apply-config should be used instead.

Without this change, OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment is broken because
the heat-config file is not created anymore in
/usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/var/run/heat-config.

Change-Id: I75d423f9fe15f2edaadba71174c4c20a3b2cd873'}]
commit_message:
Rename os-config-applier to os-apply-config

Since 1fde418207c004744dcc0d510bd88973ec05721a, os-config-applier is
deprecated. os-apply-config should be used instead.

Without this change, OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment is broken because
the heat-config file is not created anymore in
/usr/libexec/os-apply-config/templates/var/run/heat-config.

Change-Id: I75d423f9fe15f2edaadba71174c4c20a3b2cd873

commit_message:
Create snapshots if preparing of slaves fails

When some slave nodes do not bootstrap properly
while preparing slaves for further deployments
system test fails. In such cases tests should create
VMs snapshots to be able investigate why nodes
didn't boot over network.

Change-Id: Id6926637fe940dc29c0e5eb3e59a06f96e310363
Closes-bug: #1348249

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-07-24 15:43:18.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/sqlalchemy/session.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'Use SQLAlchemy cursor execute events for tracing

This change provides a consistent
system of intercepting statement executions, gaining information
about the current stack trace, and then injecting that information
either into the statement and/or logging it.   The system
works for any backend without the need to code to DBAPI
details or monkeypatching of the cursor.

Change-Id: If80db9a0a898d2cb94837ff059fc054590050506
'}]
commit_message:
Use SQLAlchemy cursor execute events for tracing

This change provides a consistent
system of intercepting statement executions, gaining information
about the current stack trace, and then injecting that information
either into the statement and/or logging it.   The system
works for any backend without the need to code to DBAPI
details or monkeypatching of the cursor.

Change-Id: If80db9a0a898d2cb94837ff059fc054590050506

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-07-19 17:01:06.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/compat/__init__.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/session.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': 'Port _is_db_connection_error check to exception filters

The last part where we are handling DB exceptions is the
_is_db_connection_error() function, which is called within a retry
loop inside of session.create_engine() to perform an initial
connection test.  SQLAlchemy currently does not run "connect"
errors through the exception handling system.  In order to have
these exceptions participate in the filtering system, add
a new function handle_connect_error(engine) which runs
engine.connect() and feeds the exception into the
handler(context) system directly, producing a compatible context
that the filters can use.   Refactor the looping mechanism within
session.create_engine() into a separate function _test_connection()
so that the logic is encapsulated and can be tested.

Change-Id: Iad1bac9d0f9202b21e4c9c170aa84494b770728d
'}]
commit_message:
Port _is_db_connection_error check to exception filters

The last part where we are handling DB exceptions is the
_is_db_connection_error() function, which is called within a retry
loop inside of session.create_engine() to perform an initial
connection test.  SQLAlchemy currently does not run "connect"
errors through the exception handling system.  In order to have
these exceptions participate in the filtering system, add
a new function handle_connect_error(engine) which runs
engine.connect() and feeds the exception into the
handler(context) system directly, producing a compatible context
that the filters can use.   Refactor the looping mechanism within
session.create_engine() into a separate function _test_connection()
so that the logic is encapsulated and can be tested.

partially implement bp: use-events-for-error-wrapping

Change-Id: Iad1bac9d0f9202b21e4c9c170aa84494b770728d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 741, 'name': 'Kiall Mac Innes', 'email': 'kiall@macinnes.ie', 'username': 'kiall'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 7536, 'name': 'Ilya Pekelny', 'email': 'ipekelny@mirantis.com', 'username': 'I159'}, {'_account_id': 11816, 'name': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'display_name': 'Mike Bayer', 'email': 'mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com', 'username': 'zzzeek', 'status': 'Red Hat'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-07-19 17:01:06.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/sqlalchemy/session.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'Integrate the ping listener into the filter system.

Replace the use of the connection pool "checkout" event
for "pinging" a connection with the use of the Connection.begin()
event.  This event corresponds to the start of a transaction, so
will "ping" the connection for every transaction rather than just
on checkout, and by running at the level of Connection rather
than the pool, we have access to the whole range of services we
need, including that we can emit a core "select([1])" that will
work on all backends, we get the use of the handle_error() event,
and we get the built in checking for "is disconnect" as well
as the engine/pool being invalidated or disposed as is appropriate
for the SQLAlchemy version in use.  The begin() event is a safe
place to recycle the connection from an invalid state back to
a ready state.

partially implement bp: use-events-for-error-wrapping

Change-Id: Ic29e12f1288f084a5e727101686dd71b12a5787b
'}]
commit_message:
Integrate the ping listener into the filter system.

Replace the use of the connection pool "checkout" event
for "pinging" a connection with the use of the Connection.begin()
event.  This event corresponds to the start of a transaction, so
will "ping" the connection for every transaction rather than just
on checkout, and by running at the level of Connection rather
than the pool, we have access to the whole range of services we
need, including that we can emit a core "select([1])" that will
work on all backends, we get the use of the handle_error() event,
and we get the built in checking for "is disconnect" as well
as the engine/pool being invalidated or disposed as is appropriate
for the SQLAlchemy version in use.  The begin() event is a safe
place to recycle the connection from an invalid state back to
a ready state.

partially implement bp: use-events-for-error-wrapping

Change-Id: Ic29e12f1288f084a5e727101686dd71b12a5787b

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-07-19 17:01:06.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/db/sqlalchemy/compat/handle_error.py', 'oslo/db/sqlalchemy/compat/utils.py', 'tests/sqlalchemy/test_handle_error.py'], 'message': 'Add disconnect modification support to exception handling

This patch backports an additional feature from the
SQLAlchemy 0.9.7 handle_error() event, the ability to alter the
"is disconnect" status of an exception.  In this case, the
supported case is only to take an exception that's not a disconnect,
and to graduate it to a disconnect.  Going in the other direction
isn't possible with the approach here because the connection invalidation
would already have taken place, as we are wrapping the _handle_dbapi_error()
method.

We may want to be able to promote an exception to "is disconnect" in
cases where special database configurations or backends such as that of
Percona have complex detection scenarios not covered by SQLAlchemy's
provided backends.

partially implement bp: use-events-for-error-wrapping

Change-Id: I23a4da2dc39af015a01d6d587c57c5e1c4b95f31
'}]
commit_message:
Add disconnect modification support to exception handling

This patch backports an additional feature from the
SQLAlchemy 0.9.7 handle_error() event, the ability to alter the
"is disconnect" status of an exception.  In this case, the
supported case is only to take an exception that's not a disconnect,
and to graduate it to a disconnect.  Going in the other direction
isn't possible with the approach here because the connection invalidation
would already have taken place, as we are wrapping the _handle_dbapi_error()
method.

We may want to be able to promote an exception to "is disconnect" in
cases where special database configurations or backends such as that of
Percona have complex detection scenarios not covered by SQLAlchemy's
provided backends.

partially implement bp: use-events-for-error-wrapping

Change-Id: I23a4da2dc39af015a01d6d587c57c5e1c4b95f31

commit_message:
Change UI descriptions of Mellanox components

This commit include changes for Mellanox UI:
  1. Change UI descriptions to better explain restrictions.
  2. Move number of virtual NICs beneath Mellanox SR-IOV
     plugin.
  3. Add opposite restrictions to openstack.yaml.

Closes-bug: #1346224

Change-Id: I2d7d218ac465e7be9e3b9650dc972051bde1b165
Signed-off-by: Aviram Bar-Haim <aviramb@mellanox.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 28, 'created': '2014-07-23 04:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['etc/l3_agent.ini', 'neutron/agent/l3_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/services/vpn/test_vpn_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': "Modify L3 Agent for Distributed Routers

This patch is an enhancement to the existing L3 Agent.
This allows the L3 Agent to support distributed routers
by enhancing the router object to function across
multiple nodes.

Utilized two new types of namespaces:

- FIP to handle multiple VM fips and routers per node
- SNAT to handle centralized SNAT per router

Rules and tables are enhanced and added to support routing
across distributed routers without going to a centralized
router.

Finally, a new configuration param 'agent_mode' is introduced
and it controls what the L3 agent can do: the available values
are: 'legacy', 'dvr', 'dvr_snat' (more details inline).

The l3-scheduler uses the newly introduced agent_mode to
determine what L3 agent to select during the scheduling
process.

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icead821bb74372b15aac2e5cefe8ad7f08c037ab
Co-Authored-By: Rajeev Grover <rajeev.grover@hp.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Modify L3 Agent for Distributed Routers

This patch is an enhancement to the existing L3 Agent.
This allows the L3 Agent to support distributed routers
by enhancing the router object to function across
multiple nodes.

Utilized two new types of namespaces:

- FIP to handle multiple VM fips and routers per node
- SNAT to handle centralized SNAT per router

Rules and tables are enhanced and added to support routing
across distributed routers without going to a centralized
router.

Finally, a new configuration param 'agent_mode' is introduced
and it controls what the L3 agent can do: the available values
are: 'legacy', 'dvr', 'dvr_snat' (more details inline).

The l3-scheduler uses the newly introduced agent_mode to
determine what L3 agent to select during the scheduling
process.

Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-ovs-dvr

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icead821bb74372b15aac2e5cefe8ad7f08c037ab
Co-Authored-By: Rajeev Grover <rajeev.grover@hp.com>

commit_message:
Added vcenter support for ostf tests.

Because in the configuration with vCenter compute node is missing, added:
1. Getting type of virtualization from cluster settings
2. Processing case when the type of virtualization is vmvare (not checked for no compute node available)
3. In test_sanity_infrastructure compute node has been replaced by a controller because
   for vmvare and neutron interaction occurs via controller node

Implements: blueprint vcenter-hv-full-scale-support
Change-Id: I4f74011de5548990f163f220632fbf4fe2ffa39e

firewall-rule-show is not showing protocol "any"

If user creates a firewall rule with protocol = any, firewall-rule-show of
that rule is not showing anything. It should display "any".

Change-Id: I726bd4990fcefac1927acc503913434b52e1f413
Closes-bug: 1336800

commit_message:
Do not log unconfigured collector as warning

The configuration will dictate whether or not something is configured.
If it is not, this is a normal state and should not be logged as a
warning.

Change-Id: I479f0aed5837871009bc69fa028f5eb64a060c53
Closes-Bug: #1321551

The TripleO projects as a whole are light on unit test coverage,
which makes reviews and refactoring more difficult and means that
less-used code paths often just don't work.  This spec proposes

commit_message:
Unit Testing TripleO Projects

The TripleO projects as a whole are light on unit test coverage,
which makes reviews and refactoring more difficult and means that
less-used code paths often just don't work.  This spec proposes
some steps that can be taken to improve the unit testing situation.

Change-Id: I6a9c3e5b4a34b0b1ba88598d1597e6940c11bcc1
Partial-Blueprint: unit-testing

commit_message:
Ensure routing key is specified in the address for a direct producer

This change is already merged in oslo-incubator.  Original commit
message body includes:

    Porting this fix from oslo.messaging.  This fixes the impl_qpid.py
    driver to allow it to work with the latest stable upstream QPID broker
    (version 0.28).  See the Apache Qpid Jira bug
    https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/QPID-5557

Change-Id: If71f78e50f8a9b3acfd1e9d02c8271f17c4ebee7
Related-Bug: #1300318
(cherry picked from commit 3597ffca77133101943114b80fd4263bada87f4f)
